intro: Spermacoce articulata, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, white or greenish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, black seeds. Spermacoce articulata is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
